text.p: These are the leading stories in the Namibian press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Economic analyst and stockbroker Johan Rossouw said Namibia was directly affected by events in South Africa and therefore interest rates and inflation were at a peak, but he predicted a lowering in both areas. He forecast a growth of two percent in Namibia's GDP over the next 12 months.
- The leader of a delegation fo German parliamentarians visiting Namibia said he would encourage German investment in the planned railway line between Tsumeb to Angola.

- The decentralisation of certain powers and functions from central government to regional and local authorities was officially launched with the announcement of a trust fund for regional development.
